item.title: Venezuelan opposition headquarters targeted in violent raid amid election dispute
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Screaming Woman' mummy: 3,500-year-old Egyptian mystery solved
item.description: A recent study led by Professor Sahar Saleem of Cairo University has revealed that the 'Screaming Woman' mummy discovered in 1935 may have experienced cadaveric spasm at death, preserving her agonised facial expression. The woman, embalmed with high-quality ingredients over 3,500 years ago, was found in a coffin among the tombs of the New Kingdom period near Luxor, Egypt.
item.dc:creator: TOI Science Desk

item.title: 21 Indian fishermen released from Sri Lanka prison return home safely
item.description: Twenty-one Indian fishermen were released from Sri Lankan custody and arrived in Chennai on Saturday, following negotiations by the Indian High Commission in Colombo. The incident involved a collision between a Sri Lankan naval vessel and an Indian fishing boat, resulting in one fisherman dead and another missing, with efforts underway to provide support to affected families.
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: These airlines cancel flights to Israel amid escalating tensions
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Royal ceasefire: Prince William had sent 'last-minute text' to his brother Harry after Queen Elizabeth's death
item.description: Prince William and Prince Harry, estranged for years, surprised fans by reuniting publically two years ago. Following Queen Elizabeth's death, the brothers, accompanied by their wives, viewed tributes and greeted the public at Windsor. William extended an olive branch via a last-minute text to Harry, marking their first public joint appearance since the Sussexes moved to the US, showing unity during national mourning.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US reinstates death penalty for 9/11 mastermind Khalid Sheikh Mohammed
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US boosts Israeli defence with warships and aircraft amid Iranian threats
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kyle Rittenhouse says he won't vote for Trump. 12 hours later, he's 100% behind MAGA
item.description: "I am confident he will be the strong ally gun owners need to defend our Second Amendment rights...I'm 100% behind Donald Trump and encourage every gun owner to join me in helping send him back to the White House," Kyle Rittenhouse said 12 hours after he announced that he won't vote for Trump and Trump has bad advisers on Second Amendment.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: After row over kissing sports minister, Macron viral for old photo with Imane Khelif
item.description: ​Amid the controversy, French president Emmanuel Macron's photo with Imane Khelif went viral social media users asking whether Macron was a fan of the Algerian boxer. The photo dates back to 2022, according to the social media posts. Macron and Imane Khelif seem to have a lot of chemistry," a post that shared the video read adding that Macron in 2022 told Imane that if she reached the final of the Olympics in Paris, he will come to support her.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Harris campaign says it raised $310m in July, more than double Trump's haul
item.description: Neither campaign disclosed precisely how much of the money was raised or held by the campaigns themselves versus their allied party committees.

item.title: US state mayor accused of minor's rape, arrested on third-degree charges
item.description: Misty Clanton Roberts, the former mayor of DeRidder, Louisiana, was arrested on charges of third-degree rape and contributing to the delinquency of a juvenile. She was later released after posting a $75,000 bond. The accusations stem from claims of sexual relations with a minor during her tenure. Roberts resigned a week before her arrest, maintaining her innocence.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US recognises Maduro's rival as winner; Uruguay and Argentina follow suit
item.description: The announcement, by secretary of state Antony Blinken, comes despite a claim by the country's authoritarian president, Nicolas Maduro, and by the govt-controlled electoral body, that Maduro had won the Sunday election.

item.title: Anti-government rallies in Bangladesh seek justice for quota protest victims
US Secret Service chief says local police not responsible for Trump shooting
item.description: "In no way should any state or local agency supporting us in Butler on July 13th be held responsible for a Secret Service failure," US Secret Service Acting Director Ronald Rowe told reporters on Friday. "This was a Secret Service failure. That roof line should have been covered - we should have had better eyes on (that)."

item.title: When JD Vance was asked whether he had a secret family in Alaska in front of his wife
item.description: ​​"Oh by the way, if I did I am not gonna admit it in front of my wife. It's one of those questions where if you got to that point in your life that you are such a dishonest person and have a secret family in Alaska, I think they would hide it. But no, I don't have a secret family in Alaska," Vance said laughing adding that they ask all these weird questions to prepare for the media firestorm.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris secures enough delegate votes to be Democrat presidential nominee, says she will officially accept next week
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Van driver arrested after crashing into gates outside Irish prime minister's office in Dublin
item.description: In Dublin, a driver was arrested for crashing his van into the gates of several government buildings, including the residences of Ireland's president and the prime minister, early Friday morning. The incidents, which occurred around 2 a.m., resulted in no injuries.

item.title: US justice department sues TikTok, accusing the company of violating a children's online privacy law
item.description: The Justice Department sued TikTok, accusing it of violating children's online privacy laws and breaking a previous settlement with the FTC. The lawsuit focused on allegations that TikTok collected personal information from children under 13 without parental consent. TikTok's failure to comply with COPPA led to millions of children accessing the regular app, exposing them to adult content.

item.title: Kamala sounds like a third grader...': VP's 'word salad' on diplomacy slammed. Vance says...
item.description: "This is just an extraordinary testament to the importance of having a president who understands the power of diplomacy and understands the strength that rests in understanding the significance of diplomacy and strengthening alliances," Kamala Harris said. Republicans said this is what Kamala sounds like when there is no script for her.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Everything, and nothing, is black and white in US elections
item.description: Donald Trump's attempt to win Black votes by questioning Kamala Harris' Black identity backfired. Trump's supporters spread images highlighting her Indian heritage, which she proudly acknowledges. However, polls show Harris retaining strong Black voter support, with Trump trailing at 15 percent. Recent incidents, including derogatory remarks about 'black jobs,' further alienated Black voters from Trump.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta
